body:
I know this a bit of a big undertaking, for not a massive amount of benefit.

Cards being put together programmatically from images, text etc would help with older cards which have since been errata'd or have more legible oracle text.

Although thinking about it - some kind of pop-up for oracle-type text would achieve the same thing.
author: [ShawnieBoyUK](https://code.google.com/u/ShawnieBoyUK/)
title: Programatically Created Card Images

comments.body:
Do you have some specific example cards where this is the case? My understanding is that if you regularly run the Download Images option you should never have missing cards. I could be wrong though. 

To create a mock card image based on card info in the database would not be too difficult.

**Labels:** Component-UI
comments.author: [lodici123](https://code.google.com/u/lodici123/)

comments.body: It's not for cards without images - it's for legibility/revised ruling on older cards. One of the things that springs to mind is the 'Grand Creature-Type Update' - Lots of Humans were added among many other changes. Can't think right now of any older cards that have printed text very different to their oracle text which haven't been reprinted.
comments.author: [ShawnieBoyUK](https://code.google.com/u/ShawnieBoyUK/)

comments.body:
I've been thinking of solving this a different way. Using the HQ Card Generator @ http://www.slightlymagic.net/forum/viewforum.php?f=30 to generate card images with updated oracle text and link to those in the scripts. 

I was inspired by MTG Remastered Editions @ http://www.slightlymagic.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=15&t=8136 unfortunately that project hasn't been updated in a while and they only distribute the files in sets.

**Labels:** -Type-Defect Type-Enhancement
comments.author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)

comments.body: Looks like a good solution - no changes required to Magarena (UI) code :)
